intro: Adenoncos papuana, commonly known as the Papuan adenoncos, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
